body_html:
I used the bazel clean command and the .so file compiled on the first try. Thank you.

However, this lead me to the next question:
Where should I put the .so file so that Android Studio can find it?
I placed it in both ~project/libs and ~project/src/app/src/main/jniLibs, but I have been unable to get Android Studio / Gradle to recognize it. For example, in the following code, org.tensorflow is not resolving:

package com.foobar.tfdemo; 

import org.tensorflow.contrib.android.TensorFlowInferenceInterface;

public class TensorFlowClassifier implements Classifier {
// do something
}

I'm wondering if there is some special location or process for bringing the .so files in to a project?
I've tried to fully document the issue in SO: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41176321/tensorflow-android-studio-and-bazel-setting-up-a-new-project
Thanks for the help!
